sourceMeaningMnemonic: This <radical>construction</radical> project made from <radical>shellfish</radical> will act as a <kanji>tribute</kanji> to the Crabigator.
meaningInfo: The Crabigator is a sea creature (maybe?), so making a tribute from shellfish makes some sense.
readingMnemonic: This great <kanji>tribute</kanji> is being commissioned by Emperor <ja><reading>こう</reading>いち</ja>.
readingInfo:
In his power, <ja>こういち</ja> has made a new religion around the Crabigator, to put the fear of kanji learning into his subjects.

Hint: When you see <ja>工</ja> in a kanji it will often take the <ja>こう</ja> reading.
